Package javelin.controller.kit

Class Kit

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.controller.kit.Kit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Barbarian, Bard, Cleric, Discipline, Dragoon, Druid, Fighter, Monk, Ninja, Paladin, Ranger, Rogue, Wizard
    public abstract class Kit
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Kits represent sets of Upgrades that constitute a role a character may have a play in. As much inspired on AD&D kits as actual character classes, these are used on the AdventurersGuild and Academy types as means of upgrading Combatants. Kits are usually created by piecing together 3 to 7 lowest-level upgrades. TODO at some point should reference all kits by Class and keep an internal Map - instead, currently when we save and load, new instance are generated needlessly. a good way to enforce that would be to make kits non-serializable.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        @Deprecated

    • Method Detail

      • define

        protected abstract void define()
        Registers around 3-5 Upgrades that all (or most) members of this Kit should share. Usually for CRs around 1-5.

      • extend

        protected abstract void extend()
        Add any other Upgrades that extend this Kit into middle, high and epic levels.

      • getpreferredability

        public int getpreferredability​(Monster m)
        TODO would be better to have the game concept of Ability as a programming unit.
        Returns:
        The value of the ability favored by this class. As such, it can be measured against the highest ability values of a unit to determine if that unit would be a good candidate for this kit.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • allow

        public boolean allow​(int bestability,
                     int secondbest,
                     Monster m)
        Returns:
        true if this is a good choice for the given Monster. The default implementation just compares the two given ability scores to this class getpreferredability(Monster).

      • getpreferred

        public static java.util.List<Kit> getpreferred​(Monster m,
                                               boolean allowprestige)
        Parameters:
        allowprestige - Disciplines are hardly suited for beginning characters so in some bases you may want not to include those as part of the result.
        Returns:
        A list of kits that should be well suited for the given Monster. Current Kit selection has been set up so that this should never be empty.

      • getupgrades

        public java.util.HashSet<Upgrade> getupgrades()
        Returns:
        All upgrades, from basic and extension on a new set.

      • rename

        public void rename​(Monster m)
        Sets Monster.customName to one of the appropriate titles.

      • createguild

        public Academy createguild()
        A District Location to learn this kit. TODO the default implemtation is temporary, see Kit.BuildSimpleGuild - move to abstract ASAP

      • buildguild

        @Deprecated
public Labor buildguild()

        temporaty class to help transtition from UpgradeHandler to a pure Kit-based system.

      • validate

        public void validate()
        Does a few sanity and design checks if in Javelin.DEBUG mode.

      • filter

        public <K extends Upgrade> java.util.List<K> filter​(java.lang.Class<K> type)
        Returns:
        All Spells that are part of this kit. May be empty.

      • finish

        public void finish()
        Allows to complete a Kit after any external pendencies are resolved, such as Summon Spells. The default implementation will transfer any Spells with Spell.casterlevel 1 to basic from basic to extension so it should be invoked at the end of a subclass' implementaion.
        See Also:
        Summon.setupsummons()

      • upgrade

        public boolean upgrade​(Combatant c)
